p: The MR model without covariate revealed a fledgling survival rate of 0.12 (95% CRI [0.08–0.19]) in chicks ( Table 2). The survival of adults was 0.87 (95% CRI: [0.83–0.90]). Throughout the study period (1982–2014), fledgling survival varied 2.56 times more than adult survival (95%, CRI [1.03–6.45]) ( Table 2).
